content: this design is my love letter to vintage aran knitting the fisherman-seaside aesthetic and my childhood memories of windy brisk holidays along the norfolk coast the honey & salt hat is knit flat and then seamed and makes a perfect challenge for knitters who want to start combining cabling techniques for a unique texture once knit up this hat is thick warm and cozy making it the perfect addition to any late autumn/winter wardrobe **difficulty level** advanced beginner/intermediate **techniques used** cast on cables & twists decreasing knit & purl knit one below purl one below seaming mattress stitch **one size fits all** circumference 52 cm length with folded cuff 16 cm total length unfolded cuff 24 cm **materials** *yarn * drops nepal 65% lana 35% alpaca 50 g skein = approx 75 m 4 skeins needed **or** an aran weight yarn that matches gauge detailed on the right side *needles * 4mm/us 6 35cm straight knitting needles *or* circular needles that measure in total about 40cm 4 5mm/us 7 35cm straight knitting needles *or* circular needles that measure in total about 40cm **notions ** cable needle safety pins stitch markers removable tapestry needle scissors **gauge** this pattern uses two distinct cable sections each knit with a different needle size to ensure accuracy and the best fit for your hat work the two separate gauge swatches as listed below and wet block them before measuring *swatch 1 - 4mm us 6 needles * note i recommend that you work a swatch that s 32 sts x 32 row to allow for 4 full repeats of the stitches described in the brackets below remember that 28 sts will measure 10 cm 10 x 10 cm = 28 sts x 32 row in the following pattern row 1 p2 k4 p2 repeat until end of row row 2 k2 p4 k2 repeat until end of row row 3 t4b t4f repeat until end of row row 4 p2 k4 p2 repeat until end of row row 5 k2 p4 k2 repeat until end of row row 6 same as row 4 row 7 t4f t4b repeat until end of row row 8 same as row 2 *swatch 2 - 4 5mm us 7 needles * 10 x 10 cm = 24 sts x 30 row in the following pattern row 1 p2 k1 p4 k1 p2 k4 p2 k1 p4 k1 p2 row 2 k2 p1b k4 p1b k2 p4 k2 p1b k4 p1b k2 row 3 p2 k1b p4 k1b p2 c4f p2 k1b p4 k1b p2 row 4 same as row 2 if your gauge measures less than the required size try a larger needle size if the gauge measures more try a smaller needle size need extra support i ve filmed step-by-step kal videos to guide you through tricky parts of the honey & salt hat you can find them on an ig highlight here 1 *last little thing every pattern i write is the final result of many hours
